sn23.2:1: At Sāvatthī. Sitting to one side, the Venerable Radha said to the Blessed One:sn.iii.90"Venerable sir, it is said, ‘a being, a being.’ In what way, venerable sir, is one called a being?"
sn23.2:2: "Suppose, Radha, some little boys or girls are playing with sand castles. So long as they are not devoid of lust, desire, affection, thirst, passion, and craving for those sand castles, they cherish them, play with them, treasure them,[n.45] I readdhanāyantiwithBeand Se, glosseddhanaṁ viya maññantiby Spk.and treat them possessively. But when those little boys or girls lose their lust, desire, affection, thirst, passion, and craving for those sand castles, then they scatter them with their hands and feet, demolish them, shatter them, and put them out of play.
